item.title: ESPN 博彩公司所有者认为在线投注亏损缩小，赌场面临挑战
item.description: 经营 ESPN Bet 在线博彩业务的宾夕法尼亚娱乐公司（Penn Entertainment Inc.【原文：Penn Entertainment Inc., which operates the ESPN Bet online gambling business, said the third-quarter loss from its interactive casino was narrower than previously forecast.】

item.title: 苹果公司全球采购主管丹-罗斯克斯将退休
item.description: 苹果公司全球供应链采购主管丹-罗斯克斯（Dan Rosckes）在这家 iPhone 制造商任职 24 年后即将退休，这将为这个关键职位带来新的管理层。【原文：Apple Inc.’s global supply chain procurement chief, Dan Rosckes, is retiring after 24 years at the iPhone maker, bringing fresh management to a critical position.】

item.title: 约翰-保尔森与波多黎各前合伙人加法尔的欺诈诉讼达成和解
item.description: 约翰-保尔森在波多黎各的前商业伙伴同意撤销对这位亿万富翁的欺诈诉讼，作为秘密和解的一部分。【原文：John Paulson’s former Puerto Rico business partner agreed to drop a fraud lawsuit against the billionaire as part of a confidential settlement.】

item.title: FTX 明确将向客户退款，因为公司要求分得 10 亿美元的一杯羹
item.description: 加密货币公司 FTX 赢得了法院的批准，将向客户全额偿还其数字资产，这些客户的数字资产在近两年前该平台发生内讧时被锁定在该平台上，这一不寻常的结果可能会让山姆-班克曼-弗里德（Sam Bankman-Fried）的欺诈交易所股东从被扣押的 10 亿美元资产中分得一杯羹。【原文：Cryptocurrency firm FTX won court approval to fully repay customers whose digital assets were locked on the platform when it imploded nearly two years ago, an unusual result that could net shareholders in Sam Bankman-Fried’s fraud-tainted exchange a slice of $1 billion in seized assets.】

item.title: 前加拿大央行官员预计 10 月将大幅降息
item.description: 加拿大银行管理机构的一位前成员表示，官员们应在本月晚些时候将借贷成本降低半个百分点。【原文：An ex-member of the Bank of Canada’s governing body said officials should cut borrowing costs by half a percentage point later this month.】

item.title: 循环信贷减少导致美国消费者借贷增长放缓
item.description: 受信用卡余额自 2021 年 3 月以来最大降幅的制约，8 月份美国消费者借贷增长速度低于上月。【原文：US consumer borrowing increased in August at a slower pace than a month earlier, restrained by the largest drop in credit-card balances since March 2021.】

item.title: 意大利央行发出对政府增长目标的担忧信号
item.description: 意大利银行对该国的经济增长表示担忧，称今年的经济扩张可能会低于此前的预期，从而使政府更难实现其目标。【原文：The Bank of Italy signaled concern about the country’s growth, saying the economy will likely expand less than previously expected this year, making it more difficult for the government to reach its targets.】

item.title: 法官裁定：Google Play 必须允许竞争对手开设 Android 应用商店
item.description: 一名法官裁定，Alphabet 公司必须取消阻止开发者建立与其 Google Play 商店竞争的竞争对手市场的限制，从而颠覆这家搜索巨头在利润丰厚的安卓应用程序市场的主导地位。【原文：Alphabet Inc. must lift restrictions that prevent developers from setting up rival marketplaces that compete with its Google Play Store, a judge ruled, upending the search giant’s dominance in the lucrative Android app market.】

item.title: 欧盟借贷部门建议通过 IPO 投资促进市场联盟
item.description: 作为降低资本壁垒和提高竞争力努力的一部分，欧盟的贷款部门正在制定促进公司在集团内上市的计划。【原文：The European Union’s lending arm is working on plans to facilitate company listings across the bloc as part of efforts to bring down barriers to capital and boost competitiveness.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯 PIF 将持有塞尔福里奇百货公司 40% 的股份
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯公共投资基金在买下现已破产的 Signa 集团的股份后，将成为连锁百货公司塞尔福里奇百货公司的少数合伙人。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund is set to become a minority partner in department store chain Selfridges after buying out the position of the now-insolvent Signa Group.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会提起的亚马逊反垄断案将在裁决后继续审理
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）必须面对美国联邦贸易委员会（US Federal Trade Commission）就其在线市场提起的反垄断诉讼，但一名联邦法官驳回了该机构与州消费者保护法相关的部分诉求。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. must face an antitrust suit filed by the US Federal Trade Commission over its online marketplace, but a federal judge dismissed some of the agency’s claims tied to state consumer protection laws.】

item.title: 美联储降息押注被修正，短期债券大跌
item.description: 在一份井喷式的就业报告导致投资者重新调整美联储再次大幅降息的可能性之后，期限最短的市政债券遭到抛售。【原文：The shortest-dated municipal bonds sold off after a blowout jobs report caused investors to recalibrate the odds of another big interest-rate cut from the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: CNRL 的 65 亿美元雪佛龙交易扩大了油砂收购热潮
item.description: 加拿大自然资源有限公司（Canadian Natural Resources Ltd.）斥资 65 亿美元从雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp. ）手中收购了阿尔伯塔省（Alberta）的大量油砂矿藏，这标志着该公司成为加拿大最大的石油生产商，并几乎完全由当地控制的一系列交易中的最新一笔。【原文：Canadian Natural Resources Ltd.’s $6.5 billion acquisition from Chevron Corp. marks the latest in a string of deals that has helped make it the country’s largest oil producer and brought Alberta’s massive oil sands deposits almost entirely under local control.】

item.title: 美国国家安全局调查中国黑客是否入侵美国电信公司
item.description: 据一位高级情报官员称，美国正在对中国可能入侵美国电信公司的行为进行早期调查。【原文：The US is in the early stages of an investigation into potential Chinese hacking of American telecommunications companies, according to a top intelligence official.】

item.title: 据说天网将为德国业务的首次公开募股选择银行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Tennet Holding BV 已选定银行帮助安排其德国业务的潜在首次公开募股。【原文：Tennet Holding BV has picked banks to help arrange a potential initial public offering of its German operations, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 德雅丹警告美国大选后加拿大经济将出现 "特朗普式下滑
item.description: Desjardins 的经济学家表示，如果唐纳德-特朗普赢得总统大选，共和党统治众议院和参议院，那么到 2028 年底，加拿大的实际国内生产总值可能会比卡马拉-哈里斯获胜时低 1.7%。【原文：Canadian real gross domestic product may be as much as 1.7% lower by the end of 2028 if Donald Trump wins the presidency and Republicans rule the House and Senate than if Kamala Harris wins, economists at Desjardins say.】

item.title: 力拓收购钒金属，锂股大涨
item.description: 在力拓集团（Rio Tinto Group）对 Arcadium Lithium Plc 进行收购后，一些锂业公司的股价大涨。【原文：Shares of some lithium companies surged after Rio Tinto Group made an approach for Arcadium Lithium Plc.】

item.title: 镍扩大涨幅，金属交易商等待中国回归
item.description: 随着供应削减成为关注焦点，镍扩大了涨幅，而其他金属在中国市场一周假期后重新开市前保持稳定。【原文：Nickel extended gains as supply cuts came into focus, while other metals held steady ahead of the reopening of Chinese markets after a weeklong holiday.】

item.title: 肥胖症药物制造商 Rivus 称最快将于今年上市
item.description: 据知情人士透露，专注于肥胖症治疗的药物开发商 Rivus Pharmaceuticals Inc.【原文：Rivus Pharmaceuticals Inc., a drug developer focused on obesity treatments, is considering a US initial public offering as soon as 2024, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 伊什比亚的 Shore Capital 为三支基金融资 19 亿美元
item.description: 由贾斯汀-伊什比亚（Justin Ishbia）领导的芝加哥私募股权投资公司 Shore Capital Partners 完成了 19 亿美元的三支新基金的募集，其中两支基金的投资重点将超越该公司传统的小企业投资领域。【原文：Shore Capital Partners, a Chicago-based private equity firm led by Justin Ishbia, closed on $1.9 billion for three new funds, two of which will focus on expanding beyond the company’s traditional sphere of small-business investment.】

item.title: 美国政府问责局称美国冲突矿产法未减少刚果战争
item.description: 美国政府问责局周一表示，美国要求公司报告其使用与刚果民主共和国冲突有关的矿产的法律并没有减少该国的暴力事件。【原文：A US law that requires companies to report on their use of minerals linked to conflict in Democratic Republic of Congo hasn’t reduced violence in the country, the Government Accountability Office said Monday.】

item.title: 霍尔茨曼告诉《德意志报》，欧洲央行的通胀之战尚未结束
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员罗伯特-霍尔茨曼（Robert Holzmann）告诉德国《南德意志报》，欧洲中央银行决不能过早宣布战胜通胀，因为潜在的价格压力仍然过高。【原文：The European Central Bank mustn’t declare victory over inflation prematurely because underlying price pressures remain too high, Governing Council member Robert Holzmann told German newspaper Sueddeutsche Zeitung.】

item.title: 仿人机器人制造商 Agility Robotics 展示其 "RoboFab
item.description:
俄勒冈州的这家公司已经让机器人在 Spanx 的仓库中工作，并在亚马逊的设施中进行试验。【原文：

The Oregon company already has robots working in a Spanx warehouse and running trials at Amazon facilities.

】

item.title: 杰富瑞称对人工智能手机的希望被过分夸大，苹果下跌
item.description: 一位杰富瑞（Jefferies）分析师称，投资者对苹果公司的最新款 iPhone 抱有过于乐观的预期，而这也是首款配备人工智能工具的 iPhone，苹果公司股价下跌超过 1%。【原文：Apple Inc. shares fell over 1% after a Jefferies analyst said investors have overly optimistic expectations for the company’s latest iPhones, the first to come with artificial-intelligence tools.】

item.title: 埃利奥特竞购 Citgo 为委内瑞拉投资者带来罕见回报
item.description: 委内瑞拉国有石油公司在过去五年中没有向债券持有人支付过一分钱。然而，持有一种特殊证券的投资者正准备大赚一笔。【原文：Venezuela’s state oil company hasn’t paid bondholders a dime in the last five years. Yet, investors who’ve held on to one particular security are getting ready for a massive payoff.】

item.title: 高盛认为，随着市场扩大，首次公开募股的高门槛将有所放宽
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：The spreading of the rally across equity markets into more than just a handful of stocks is making room for more initial public offerings, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s global head of equity capital markets.】

item.title: 俄罗斯部长呼吁农民为持续缺雨祈祷
item.description: 俄罗斯农业部长奥克萨娜-卢特（Oksana Lut）呼吁人们去教堂祈祷降雨，因为持续缺乏降水使冬小麦播种面临风险。【原文：Russian Agriculture Minister Oksana Lut urged people to go to church and pray for rain as the persistent lack of precipitation puts the sowing of winter wheat at risk.】

item.title: 埃里克-亚当斯的指控如何使纽约市的匹配基金计划成为焦点
item.description: 今年 9 月，纽约市长埃里克-亚当斯（Eric Adams）因联邦腐败指控被起诉，这让纽约市慷慨的竞选配套资金计划成为焦点。【原文：When New York Mayor Eric Adams was indicted on federal corruption charges in September, it thrust the city’s generous campaign matching-funds program into the spotlight.】

item.title: 林德纳称德国不能满足于经济发展道路
item.description: 德国财政部长克里斯蒂安-林德纳（Christian Lindner）表示，德国的经济发展轨迹还有许多不足之处。【原文：Germany’s economic trajectory leaves much to be desired, according to Finance Minister Christian Lindner.】

item.title: 马斯克的 X 被最高法院驳回，原因是司法部对特朗普的秘密逮捕令
item.description: 美国最高法院驳回了埃隆-马斯克的 X 公司的上诉，避免了因司法部对唐纳德-特朗普社交媒体账户相关记录的秘密搜查令而引发的冲突。【原文：The US Supreme Court turned away an appeal by Elon Musk’s X Corp., steering clear of a clash over a secret Justice Department search warrant for records related to Donald Trump’s social media account.】
